config.taskName: Add needs triage label to new issues
Replace needs author feedback label with needs attention label when the author comments on an issue
Remove no recent activity label from issues
Remove no recent activity label when an issue is commented on
Close stale issues
Add no recent activity label to issues

parameters.comment: Hi, we're sending this friendly reminder because we haven't heard back from you in **7 days**. We need more information about this issue to help address it. Please be sure to give us your input. If we don't hear back from you within **14 days** of this comment the issue will be automatically closed. Thank you!

config.taskName: Remove needs-triage label on issues once they are labeled
Add customer-reported label to issues coming from non-collaborators
For issues closed due to inactivity, re-open an issue if issue author posts a reply within 7 days.
For issues closed with no activity over 7 days, ask non-contributor to consider opening a new issue instead.

parameters.comment: Thank you for your interest in this issue! Because it has been closed for a period of time, we strongly advise that you open a new issue linking to this to ensure better visibility of your comment.

config.taskName: Add label after "Service Attention" is removed
Auto PR based on folder paths
Ensure 'needs-team-attention' label is assigned to issues not in a milestone

config.replyTemplate: Thanks for the feedback! We are routing this to the appropriate team for follow-up. cc ${mentionees}.
config.taskName: Triage issues to the service team
Remove needs* labels when needs-author-feedback label is added
Auto merge pull requests
config.label: auto-merge

config.taskName: Add customer-reported label to PRs from customers

parameters.comment: Thank you for your contribution @${issueAuthor}! We will review the pull request and get back to you soon.

config.taskName: [Stale Pull Requests] Remove Stale PR Designation on Activity
[Stale Pull Requests] Remove Stale PR Designation on on Review

parameters.commentPattern: Since there hasn't been recent engagement, this is being closed out.

config.taskName: [Stale Pull Requests] Remove Stale PR Designation on on Comment
[Stale Pull Requests] Scheduled Close for Stale PRs

parameters.comment: Hi @${issueAuthor}.  Thank you for your contribution.  Since there hasn't been recent engagement, we're going to close this out.  Feel free to respond with a comment containing "/reopen" if you'd like to continue working on these changes.  Please be sure to use the command to reopen or remove the "no-recent-activity" label; otherwise, this is likely to be closed again with the next cleanup pass.

config.taskName: [Stale Pull Requests] Reopen Command
[Stale Pull Requests] Scheduled Marking of Stale PRs

parameters.comment: Hi @${issueAuthor}.  Thank you, for your interest in helping to improve the Azure SDK experience and for your contribution.  We've noticed that there hasn't been recent engagement on this pull request.  If this is still an active work stream, please let us know by pushing some changes or leaving a comment.  Otherwise, we'll close this out in 7 days.

config.taskName: [Auto Merge] Reset Approvals on Untrusted Changes

parameters.comment: Hi @{issueAuthor}.  We've noticed that new changes have been pushed to this pull request.  Because it is set to automatically merge, we've reset the approvals to allow the opportunity to review the updates.

config.taskName: [Resolve Workflow] Issue Addressed Label Applied

parameters.comment: Hi @${issueAuthor}.  Thank you for opening this issue and giving us the opportunity to assist.  We believe that this has been addressed.  If you feel that further discussion is needed, please add a comment with the text “`/unresolve`” to remove the “issue-addressed” label and continue the conversation.

config.taskName: [Resolve Workflow] Close Addressed Issues

parameters.comment: Hi @${issueAuthor}, since you haven’t asked that we “`/unresolve`” the issue, we’ll close this out. If you believe further discussion is needed, please add a comment “`/unresolve`” to reopen the issue.

config.taskName: [Resolve Workflow] Unresolve Command by Author
[Resolve Workflow] Unresolve Command Without Permissions

parameters.comment: Hi ${contextualAuthor}, only the original author of the issue can ask that it be unresolved.  Please open a new issue with your scenario and details if you would like to discuss this topic with the team.

config.taskName: [Resolve Workflow] Unresolve on WIP Labels
[CXP Pilot] CXP Attention Responder

parameters.comment: Thank you for your feedback.  This has been routed to the support team for assistance.
